title: A linear equation is an equation that makes a straight line when it is graphed. It has the general form:
- **c** is the constant on the other side
To solve equations
subject: perform the same operation on both sides.

title: An object at rest stays at rest
subject: and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

title: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.
For every action
subject: there is an equal and opposite reaction.

title: - **Heavy objects fall faster:** All objects fall at the same rate in vacuum
- **Force equals weight:** Weight is a type of force
subject: but not all forces are weight

title: - **Inertia means laziness:** Inertia is resistance to change in motion
subject: not reluctance to work

title: The periodic table organizes elements by:
1. All living organisms are composed of cells
2. The cell is the basic unit of life
3. All cells come from pre-existing cells
- Controls movement of substances in/out of cell
- Singular subject takes singular verb: *The dog barks*
- Plural subject takes plural verb: *The dogs bark*
- Compound subjects: *Tom and Jerry are friends*
- **Present Simple:** I eat breakfast every day
- **Future Simple:** I will eat breakfast tomorrow
- **Present Continuous:** I am eating breakfast now
- **Past Continuous:** I was eating breakfast when you called
- **Passive:** The mouse was chased by the cat
- Before conjunctions in compound sentences: *I came
subject: but I couldn't stay*

title: - Colons introduce lists or explanations: *There are three colors: red
subject: blue

title: - Semicolons join related independent clauses: *I have a big test tomorrow; I can't go out tonight*
- Question marks end questions: *What time is it?*
- Exclamation points show strong emotion: *That's amazing!*
1. The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
2. She sings beautifully in the school choir.
2. I have saw that movie three times.
3. She is the most happiest person I know.
4. The book is on the table which I bought yesterday.
1. I eat breakfast every morning. (past simple)
2. She is reading a book. (past continuous)
